name: Pea, Cabbage, Parmesan and Mint Salad
description: This is one of those salads where it only takes one bite to know that you could eat the entire bowl yourself as a meal instead of sharing it between 4 as a side. Adapted from a recipe by Karen Martini, a great Australian chef.
recipeIngredient: 3 cups green or white cabbage (, finely sliced)

recipeInstructions.text: Reserve 1 tbsp of the parmesan cheese as garnish.
recipeInstructions.name: Reserve 1 tbsp of the parmesan cheese as garnish.

recipeInstructions.text: Place all ingredients in a bowl and toss gently to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: Place all ingredients in a bowl and toss gently to combine.

recipeInstructions.text: Allow to sit for 5 minutes to allow the cabbage to wilt slightly.
recipeInstructions.name: Allow to sit for 5 minutes to allow the cabbage to wilt slightly.

recipeInstructions.text: Adjust seasoning with extra salt and pepper (if required), garnish with reserved 1 tbsp parmesan cheese and serve.
recipeInstructions.name: Adjust seasoning with extra salt and pepper (if required), garnish with reserved 1 tbsp parmesan cheese and serve.

review.reviewBody: Very good, even tho I didn't have the mint. Refreshing and light. Can't wait to try with the mint, will be even better. Thanks, Nagi

Four of my favourite ingredients bound by a lemon dressing. This was YUM.  I had no radish so substituted finely sliced lebanese cucumber. This will be made again.  The only question I have is: why did it take me so long to find and make this salad???

Thanks Nagi. I had a lot of Wombok and mint left over from a Viet salad, and all the other ingredients in the fridge, so thought Iâ€™d try this and it was really fresh and delicious. It will definitely be a go to salad to use up excess Wombok from now on!
Yummmm. This looks delicious ... more salad recipes please!
